snippet: Larger, taller machines could eventually make faster winds at higher altitudes an economical source of electricity, said Ernest Moniz, the energy secretary.
abstract: Energy Department report finds that next generation of turbines could allow wind energy production in additional 700,000 square miles of United States, area that would encompass all 50 states for first time; new machinery would be far taller, reaching from 360 to 460 feet high.
lead_paragraph: Larger, taller machines could eventually make faster winds at higher altitudes an economical source of electricity, said Ernest Moniz, the energy secretary.

headline.main: Wind Power Is Poised to Spread to All States
headline.print_headline: Wind Power Is Poised to Spread to All States
